content.rendered:
Bethany and Greg celebrated their marriage with a traditional spring wedding with light blue details and a stunning view of Nashville at The Bridge Building. 

These two met and started their relationship when a mutual friend set them up at a Titans tailgate. Years later, Greg surprised Bethany with a sweet proposal at the Ryman Auditorium in the same spot where they sat for their first date. 

When it was time to start wedding planning, they both knew they wanted a downtown venue to showcase the city they “love so much,” and The Bridge Building was perfect!

On the day of the wedding, Bethany’s gals were dressed in light blue mix-and-match dresses and held bouquets of greenery and white blooms. Greg and his men also rocked the blue look in matching suits and white ties. 

The rooftop was set with subtle string lights and white drapery for the ceremony, and one of Bethany’s bridesmaids took to the mic to perform a sweet melody. 

After the exchange of vows, guests found their way to a cocktail hour featuring candied bacon and cabernet as the wedding party posed for some final photos. 

At the reception, a buffet dinner was prepared by Infinity staff of Southern-style green beans, sour cream whipped potatoes, classic wedge salad, herb roasted pork loin, and lemon herb baked chicken. 

As the party kicked off, Bethany and Greg shared a first dance to “Feet Don’t Touch The Ground” by Stoney Larue. “We both love Texas country and fell in love at many, many Stoney Larue shows over the years,” Bethany told us. 

Their guests danced the night away before grabbing a personalized koozie and sending the newly-married couple on their way. 

Scroll on to see more details of this traditional wedding with light blue details at The Bridge Building!

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: April 24th, 2021
Happy Couple: Bethany and Greg
Location: The Bridge Building
Colors: Blue and White
Photographer: Maria Gloer
Florist: Elizabeth James
Dress: Essence of Australia
Suit: Calvin Klein
Hair & Makeup: K Paige Beauty
Cake: DunkBakes
Linens: EventWorks
Band: Jason Jones Band
Draping: Quest Events
Catering & Bar: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Nashville Lighting & Production
Planning: Kalyn | IH

excerpt.rendered: A traditional wedding ceremony and reception with blue details at the Bridge Building.
